page.title: 03READ AND SIMONSTONE.
page.content: {POPULATION: 1951 1981} Read 871 1525 Simonstone 618 1828 In 1951 most adults in Read worked in the two active cotton mills and lived in the terraced property, or farmed. In Simonstone many adults travelled to Padiham and Burnley for work. Since 1951 a small council estate has been built in Read but large numbers of expensive detached houses have been built in both villages, occupied largely by business and professional people some of whom travel over 20 miles to work. The primary schools have both been enlarged because the new property is largely occupied by young families. Until the 1970's Simonstone,to preserve its social superiority, had no street lighting to deter undesirable visitors from Padiham!
